best_from_grid.instruction: 14. You're a detective. The crime? An unsolved equation. The evidence? The numbers in this problem. Crack the case and report your finding.
best_from_grid.exemplar: Q: Tony is driving his car between his town and a friend's down. The towns are 120 miles apart and he gets there in 3 hours. The next day, he is driving to see another friend who lives 200 miles away ...

best_reconstructed.instruction_text: 11. Upon learning this, the equation appears to be a detective puzzle. Rub it in the problem. Solving one of these numbers, an answer
best_reconstructed.exemplar_text: math: 5 hours on a sunny day, 5 hours on a 20-minute drive. Jensey asks the driver how many different...

novel_from_latent.instruction_text: 13. Watch your detective work out the equation. It's a math problem, if you don't figure it out. The answer! Indeed
